div.p: Common questions about this initiative and the SPCA Chandigarh situation.

div.class: bg-white rounded-xl p-6 shadow-md hover:shadow-lg transition-shadow

button.class: flex justify-between items-center w-full text-left focus:outline-none
button.h3: What is the purpose of this document portal?

div.p: This portal provides public access to official documentation related to SPCA Chandigarh. Following investigations revealing concerning conditions, we're making all records transparent to ensure accountability and drive positive change for animal welfare. The evidence includes court orders, RTI responses, emails, and other official communications.

div.class: bg-white rounded-xl p-6 shadow-md hover:shadow-lg transition-shadow

button.class: flex justify-between items-center w-full text-left focus:outline-none

div.p: Yes, all documents provided on this portal are authentic. They include official RTI responses showing the 47% mortality rate, court judgments from the Punjab and Haryana High Court, AWBI inspection reports, email correspondence with officials, and WhatsApp conversations among volunteers. We provide the complete original documents for you to read and verify.

div.class: bg-white rounded-xl p-6 shadow-md hover:shadow-lg transition-shadow

button.class: flex justify-between items-center w-full text-left focus:outline-none
button.h3: How can I help improve conditions at SPCA Chandigarh?

div.p: You can contribute by volunteering, donating supplies, sharing this portal to raise awareness, or contacting officials to demand action. The Contact section provides information on how to get involved and report additional concerns. Together, we can push for essential reforms like proper veterinary staffing, improved facilities, transparent operations, and better animal care standards.

div.class: bg-white rounded-xl p-6 shadow-md hover:shadow-lg transition-shadow

button.class: flex justify-between items-center w-full text-left focus:outline-none
button.h3: Why is this site called SPCA.wtf?

div.p: The domain name reflects our genuine reaction to the conditions documented at the facility. "WTF" stands for "Where's The Funding?" and "Why The Failure?" ‚Äì questions we believe the public deserves answers to regarding animal welfare management. With a 47% mortality rate and repeated court interventions, we believe this expression captures the appropriate level of concern.
Have more information about SPCA Chandigarh that should be documented? Let us know.

div.class: md:w-1/3 gradient-bg text-white p-8 flex flex-col justify-between

div.p: Get in touch with us directly or use the form to submit information.

p: WhatsApp group conversations documenting day-to-day challenges, volunteer efforts, and systemic issues at the facility.

div.p: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has repeatedly intervened on SPCA Chandigarh matters due to serious concerns about animal welfare.

div.class: w-12 h-12 bg-accent/20 rounded-lg flex items-center justify-center mr-4

div.p: The High Court directed the Chandigarh administration to restore earlier visiting hours for animal lovers after determining that restrictive timings were hampering animal welfare.

a.class: mt-6 inline-flex items-center text-accent font-medium group-hover:underline

div.class: w-12 h-12 bg-accent/20 rounded-lg flex items-center justify-center mr-4

div.p: Court directed both Punjab and Haryana to rectify discrepancies within 15 days as identified by court-appointed local commissioners regarding the functioning of SPCAs, with penalties threatened for non-compliance.

a.class: mt-6 inline-flex items-center text-accent font-medium group-hover:underline
btn-accent inline-flex items-center px-6 py-3 bg-accent text-gray-900 rounded-lg shadow-lg hover:shadow-xl transform transition hover:-translate-y-1 font-bold

div.p: A timeline of key events showing the pattern of issues and insufficient action at SPCA Chandigarh.

div.class: absolute left-0 md:left-1/2 ml-4 md:ml-0 border-l-2 md:border-l-0 md:border-b-2 border-primary border-dashed h-full md:h-auto md:w-full top-0 md:top-1/2 md:transform md:-translate-y-1/2 z-0
md:w-5/12 bg-white p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg md:text-right relative
w-8 h-8 bg-primary rounded-full flex items-center justify-center
w-8 h-8 bg-primary rounded-full flex items-center justify-center

div.p: RTI response revealed 47% mortality rate (6,383 animals) at the SPCA facility, with 73% (4,665) being street dogs.

div.class: bg-white p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg relative md:w-5/12
w-8 h-8 bg-primary rounded-full flex items-center justify-center
w-8 h-8 bg-primary rounded-full flex items-center justify-center

div.p: Animal Welfare Board of India (AWBI) report identified serious lapses in SPCA functioning, including unqualified staff and lack of specialized facilities.

div.class: md:w-5/12 bg-white p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg md:text-right relative
w-8 h-8 bg-primary rounded-full flex items-center justify-center
w-8 h-8 bg-primary rounded-full flex items-center justify-center

div.p: Punjab and Haryana High Court directed the Chandigarh administration to restore earlier visiting hours for animal lovers, ensuring they have a voice in animal welfare.

div.class: bg-white p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg relative md:w-5/12
w-8 h-8 bg-primary rounded-full flex items-center justify-center
w-8 h-8 bg-primary rounded-full flex items-center justify-center

div.p: Email sent to Municipal Commissioner highlighting urgent infrastructure and staffing issues at SPCA Chandigarh, with Maneka Gandhi copied.

div.class: md:w-5/12 bg-white p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg md:text-right relative
w-8 h-8 bg-primary rounded-full flex items-center justify-center
w-8 h-8 bg-primary rounded-full flex items-center justify-center

div.p: After continued issues and insufficient action, this document transparency portal goes live to ensure public awareness and accountability.
Official data reveals the extent of issues at SPCA Chandigarh. These figures come directly from RTI responses and official reports.
Of 13,567 animals brought to the shelter between Jan 2019 and Sep 2021, 6,383 died during treatment.
4,665 street dogs died at the facility, representing 73% of the total animal deaths during the period.
During a nine-month period in 2021 alone, 2,315 animals of different species died at the SPCA Chandigarh facility.
Chandigarh reported over 150 cases of cruelty to animals in the 2021-2022 fiscal year alone.

47% Mortality Rate Revealed in RTI
Why This Matters
The Truth About SPCA Chandigarh
After years of documented issues, we're making all the evidence public. This is about accountability and transparency in animal welfare.
RTI responses reveal that 47% of animals (6,383) brought to the shelter between January 2019 and September 2021 died during treatment. These documents show a pattern of issues including:
Lack of qualified veterinary staff
Poor infrastructure for animal care
High mortality rates (73% for street dogs)
Legal violations identified by courts
